[id='migration-obtaining-service-account-token-cam_{context}']
= Obtaining a service account token to add a cluster to the CAM web console

You can obtain a service account token with `cluster-admin` privileges for each cluster to be added to the CAM web console.

.Prerequisites

* CAM operator installed on the cluster

.Procedure

. Obtain the service account token:
+
----
$ oc sa get-token -n openshift-migration migration-operator
eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IiJ9..xqeeAINK7UXpdRqAtOj70qhBJPeMwmgLomV9iFxr5RoqUgKchZRG2J2rkqmPm6vr7K-cm7ibD1IBpdQJCcVDuoHYsFgV4mp9vgOfn9osSDp2TGikwNz4Az95e81xnjVUmzh-NjDsEpw71DH92iHV_xt2sTwtzftS49LpPW2LjrV0evtNBP_t_RfskdArt5VSv25eORl7zScqfe1CiMkcVbf2UqACQjo3LbkpfN26HAioO2oH0ECPiRzT0Xyh-KwFutJLS9Xgghyw-LD9kPKcE_xbbJ9Y4Rqajh7WdPYuB0Jd9DPVrslmzK-F6cgHHYoZEv0SvLQi-PO0rpDrcjOEQQ
----

. Save the service account token string. You will use it to add a cluster to the CAM web console.
